channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Pence claims 'encouraging news' as US Covid-19 cases surge
'Something's not working': States shift from reopening to containment as US sees record number of cases
CNN's Don Lemon: This is what American carnage looks like
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon discusses President Donald Trump's response to the pandemic as 60% of states report a rise in new coronavirus cases.

item.title: Trump can't divert military funds for border wall, federal appeals court says
item.description: The Trump administration doesn't have the authority to divert Pentagon funds to construct additional barriers on the US-Mexico border, a federal appeals court ruled Friday, days after President Donald Trump's visit to a section of the wall in Arizona.

item.title: Satellite images show buildup at site of deadly India-China border clash
Young people hit hardest by hidden toll of coronavirus
item.description: A CDC study shows a third of America has reported experiencing signs of anxiety and depression during the coronavirus pandemic. CNN's Sanjay Gupta reports.

item.title: People close to Biden's VP search say these are the four leading prospects
item.description: Joe Biden is entering the final month of his search for a running mate, a decision people close to the process say is now heavily influenced by a national reckoning on racism, as his search committee pores over records and conducts interviews before presenting a list of finalists to the former vice president.

item.title: Siya Kakkar, teenage TikTok star, has died, her manager confirms
item.description: Siya Kakkar, a teenage TikTok influencer with a significant fanbase on the video-sharing platform, has died, her manager has said.

item.title: Germany troop withdrawal highlights rising fortunes of two White House allies
item.description: The White House's plan to withdraw thousands of US troops from Germany is emerging as a new point of tension between the President and top Pentagon leaders, including Defense Secretary Mark Esper, who has avoided criticizing the move publicly but has significant concerns about it, multiple current and former officials tell CNN.

item.title: Mexico City security chief injured in shooting and 3 others killed
item.description: Mexico City's secretary of public security, Omar Garcia Harfuch, was wounded and three others were killed during a shooting early Friday morning, said Mexico City Mayor Claudia Sheinbaum on Twitter moments after the attack.

item.title: England goes to the beach and parties like there's no pandemic
item.description: Visiting the coast, going to parties and getting excited about football are common ingredients of an English summer. But UK authorities are concerned that such activities could be lethal during a pandemic.

item.title: Witness in the Mueller investigation and informal Trump adviser gets 10 years in prison in child sex case
item.description: George Nader, who was a key witness in the Russia investigation and informally advised President Donald Trump's team on foreign policy, was sentenced on Friday to 10 years in prison by a federal judge in Virginia, stemming from his convictions on child sex charges.

item.title: Suspect shot dead and six injured in stabbing spree in Scotland
item.description: A male suspect was shot by armed police during a major incident in the city center of Glasgow, Scotland in which an officer was reportedly stabbed.

item.title: Dow slides 700 points as the economic outlook gets drearier
item.description: The Dow and the broader US stock market tumbled Friday as investors grow increasingly worried about the economic outlook.

item.title: A nation's vast vaults of whitewashed history are being called into question. Will demands for reform finally be heard?
item.description: After years of resisting calls for its removal, New York's American Museum of Natural History (AMNH) has asked the city to dislodge from its front steps an equestrian monument to Theodore Roosevelt, the twenty-sixth US president, which depicts him charging forward, and towering over two mostly nude figures, one Black and one Indigenous.

item.title: White supremacists openly organize racist violence on Telegram, report finds
item.description: On June 5, a car full of White supremacists drove through the streets of Knoxville, Tennessee, harassing and abusing people attending a Black Lives Matter protest. One of those in the car shouted to a group of protesters: "You wanna die? Come on in. 9mm with your name on it."

item.title: Facebook and Twitter stock dives as advertiser pulls out
item.description: Shares of both Facebook and Twitter were down more than 7% in mid-day trading Friday after Unilever said it would pull its advertising from the social media companies for the rest of the year.

item.title: Ex-F1 leader says Black people are often 'more racist than White people'
item.description: Bernie Ecclestone is credited with transforming Formula One into a global, billion-dollar business with races in all corners of the world, but like many organizations, the sport he helped create has come under scrutiny following George Floyd's death.

item.title: This major cruise ship is headed for the scrap heap amid Covid-19 crisis
item.description: A major cruise liner with only 23 years of service has been earmarked for the scrap heap amid a coronavirus-driven downturn for the leisure shipping industry.

item.title: Bill Gates predicted the pandemic. Hear his advice now
item.description: Microsoft founder Bill Gates discusses his pandemic prediction, and why the US is struggling to contain the coronavirus.

item.title: Paralympian Angela Madsen found dead while trying to row from California to Hawaii
item.description: Three-time Paralympian Angela Madsen died earlier this week while attempting a solo row from Los Angeles to Honolulu.

item.title: China loves John Bolton's book for embarrassing Trump, but not the parts about Xi Jinping
item.description: It's safe to say former White House national security adviser John Bolton's book has made a splash.

item.title: A teenager who threw a 6-year-old boy from London's Tate Modern museum has been jailed for at least 15 years
item.description: A London judge has handed down a sentence of at least 15 years in prison to a teenager who threw a young French boy from a viewing platform at the Tate Modern art gallery last summer, telling him "you may never be released."

item.title: Justin Bieber files $20 million defamation lawsuit against women who accused him of assault
item.description: Justin Bieber has filed a $20 million defamation lawsuit against two women who accused him earlier this week of sexual assault.

item.title: Fancy a peek from the top of Eiffel Tower? You'll need to earn it
item.description: CNN's Cyril Vanier visits the Eiffel Tower in Paris as it reopens following its longest period of closure since WWII as the French capital emerges from lockdown.

item.title: Face mask resistance group handing out fake exemption cards on Facebook
item.description: The US Department of Justice is warning Americans about fraudulent cards distributed on Facebook by a group encouraging people to not wear masks during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Whole Foods workers sent home for wearing Black Lives Matter masks
item.description: A group of Whole Foods employees in a Boston-area store walked out to protest the company's policy that prevented them from wearing Black Lives Matter paraphernalia.

item.title: CNN analyst on New York Times poll: This is huge
item.description: A New York Times poll looking at six key battleground states found that former Vice President Joe Biden is leading President Donald Trump by double-digits in some of those states. CNN's Harry Enten explains.

item.title: YouTube influencer quits her channel after blackface backlash
item.description: YouTube star Jenna Mourey, known by her channel name Jenna Marbles, announced Thursday she is leaving the platform amid a controversy over racially offensive videos.

item.title: Former UK PM: We need new organization for pandemic readiness
item.description: CNN's Kim Brunhuber speaks with British former Prime Minister David Cameron, who says the world needs a new international organization to scan for emerging viruses.

item.title: Chinese city launches domestic violence database for couples planning to get married
item.description: A city in eastern China is launching a database for people considering marriage to check the domestic violence records of their partner.

item.title: This New Hampshire town's voting system is 130 years old
item.description: The town of Windsor, New Hampshire, has been using the same paper ballot box for 130 years and election officials say it's one of the safest ways to vote.

item.title: Sherlock Holmes is too nice in upcoming Netflix adaptation, lawsuit argues
item.description: Arthur Conan Doyle's estate is suing Netflix, among others, over its upcoming film "Enola Holmes" -- arguing that the show's depiction of Sherlock Holmes as kind, caring and respectful of women is a violation of the author's copyright.

item.title: Demi Moore looks futuristic in new trailer for dystopian series 'Brave New World'
item.description: A new trailer has dropped for "Brave New World," a series remake of Aldous Huxley's classic tale of utopia gone wrong.

item.title: NASA is offering $35,000 to design a toilet that will work on the moon
item.description: NASA wants you to help put the loo in lunar, so it's offering $35,000 in prizes to design a toilet that can be used on the moon.

item.title: UK prepares for holiday air bridges to Europe
item.description: Summer trips to hotspots such as France, Greece and Spain are expected to be back on the cards for isolated British travelers as their government wraps up talks with European countries on so-called air bridges that will bypass coronavirus quarantines.

item.title: Ian McKellen is planning to play Hamlet -- at the age of 81
item.description: At an age when most classical actors are honing their King Lear, 81-year-old Ian McKellen is set to grab a skull and throw himself into what is probably Shakespeare's most famous role: Hamlet.

item.title: Endless summers of the communist riviera
item.description: During the communist era, travel options were limited in Hungary and Central Europe, which meant Lake Balaton became the region's most popular vacation destination.

item.title: The Dixie Chicks are now called The Chicks
item.description: The former Dixie Chicks announced they will now be known as The Chicks, dropping the reference to the pre-Civil War South from the group's name.

item.title: Black trans model fronts Calvin Klein's Pride campaign
item.description: In front of a massive Calvin Klein billboard in Manhattan, Black transgender model, actress and activist Jari Jones popped a bottle of champagne while her own likeness looked down over the city streets. The image of herself she was celebrating is part of Calvin Klein's 2020 Pride campaign #PROUDINMYCALVINS, which features a cast of nine LGBTQ models including Jones, who identifies as a transqueer lesbian.

item.title: Nigerian kids 'Ikorodu Bois' get Hollywood invite after recreating movie trailer
item.description: The Nigerian kids famous for remaking multimillion-dollar music videos and movie trailers with household items may be heading to Hollywood.

item.title: Comedian says he regrets having mostly white male staff on show
item.description: Comedian Jon Stewart admits his late-night show "The Daily show" didn't do enough to address diversity and regrets having a mostly white male staff.

item.title: Photos show the Cape Town you don't usually see
item.description: When you think of Cape Town, what do you imagine? Perhaps you picture Table Mountain, penguins on the sand, or the stunning beaches that surround this city.

item.title: At first task force briefing in nearly two months, Vice President defends reopening despite record outbreaks
'Something's not working': US experts alarmed by record cases
item.description: With infection numbers rising in more than 30 states, the US set a daily record for new coronavirus cases. And federal health officials warned that the number of people who've been infected is vastly undercounted.

item.title: Public health officials blame America's lack of leadership
item.description: Even after widespread lockdowns, the United States has failed to stomp out the coronavirus and again finds itself in a rapid surge of cases. Public health experts place particular blame on a lack of leadership.

item.title: See Gupta's response to Pence's false claim about virus
item.description: CNN's Sanjay Gupta breaks down the White House coronavirus task force briefing in which Vice President Mike Pence said that the reopening economy was encouraging news as cases hit an all-time record in the US.

item.title: Love for EU surges in Brexit Britain
item.description: Four years on from the UK's Brexit vote, a majority of British voters would now opt to remain inside the European Union, says new research.

item.title: Wrongly arrested man sues police
item.description: Video shows the moment police in Valdosta, Georgia slammed a man to the ground and broke his wrist before it turned out that he was not the person they were looking for.

item.title: Report: Forced disappearances rising in Venezuela
item.description: John Jairo Gasparini drove his motorcycle into town on March 18 to buy gloves and face masks, required by the Venezuelan government to protect against the spread of the new coronavirus.
